content:
Welcome to the ACM Learning@Scale Flipped Course! To get started, click on the 'course' tab above. We'd ask you to step through the sequences for all of the full papers before showing up to the second day of Learning@Scale to be prepared for the flipped activities at the conference.

You may enjoy working through many of the work-in-progress papers. We were impressed with the quality of some of the presentations there as well.

If you'd like to reuse any of the materials in this course, please fork us on github. This course is playable in any Open edX install (and, hopefully eventually, other OLX players).

The flipped session will be run on the second day of L@S, Tuesday. There will be two flipped sessions:

Sesson #5: Flipped session - Crowdsourcing the feedback

Room: Pentland E+W

  • 5B: Improving the Peer Assessment Experience on MOOC Platforms by Thomas Staubitz, Dominic Petrick, Matthias Bauer, Jan Renz, Christoph Meinel
  • 5C: Graders as Meta-Reviewers: Simultaneously Scaling and Improving Expert Evaluation for Large Online Classrooms by David A. Joyner, Wade Ashby, Liam Irish, Yeeling Lam, Jacob Langson, Isabel Lupiani, Mike Lustig, Paige Pettoruto, Dana Sheahen, Angela Smiley, Amy Bruckman

Sesson #6: Flipped session - Outside the MOOC

Room: Pentland E+W

  • 6A: Learning Transfer: Does It Take Place in MOOCs? An Investigation into the Uptake of Functional Programming in Practice by Guanliang Chen, Dan Davis, Claudia Hauff, Geert-Jan Houben
  • 6B: The Role of Social Media in MOOCs: How to Use Social Media to Enhance Student Retention by Saijing Zheng, Kyungsik Han, Mary Beth Rosson, John M. Carroll

Please make sure you finish this course before the flipped sessions of the conference. The sessions will presume you know the material in this course.
